org_midgardproject_projectsite_document.title: Application configuration
org_midgardproject_projectsite_document.content: <div><p>Application configuration is a configuration file read before Midgard MVC starts where you can define application-wide shared configuration settings, including overriding Midgard MVC default configurations. The components used with an application are defined in the application configuration file.</p></div><div><p>The application configuration is by default located in the root of your Midgard MVC installation directory in a YAML file called <i>application.yml</i>. Example:</p></div><div><pre>name: Example Blog<br />components:<br />    midgardmvc_core:<br />        - {type: github, user: midgardproject, repository: midgardmvc_core, branch: master}<br />    org_midgardproject_projectsite:<br />        - {type: github, user: midgardproject, repository: org_midgardproject_projectsite, branch: master}<br />services_dispatcher: midgard2<br />providers_component: midgardmvc</pre></div><div><p>You can also define a custom location for your application configuration file by setting <i>midgardmvc.application_config</i> in your php.ini. Example:</p></div><div><pre>midgardmvc.application_config=/etc/midgard2/example.yml</pre></div><p>Please note that only the components specified in your Application YAML file (and their dependencies) will be available in this Midgard MVC instance.</p>
